ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned more about psychological research design
Understanding and analyzing research in political science/psychology, writing effective analyses, and developing a research project

PLSC 384 surveys a broad range of topics in political psychology ranging from cognition to social identity theory. The course also helps me to expand my understanding of political science research methods and how to effectively deploy them in future research of my own.

This course places politics and psychology into conversation with one another, specifically by bridging the gap between comparative politics and political psychology. By taking this course, I learned about a diverse set of topics ranging from cognition to context.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought the readings were very interesting, but would have liked a more guided walk through of the main highlights during class instead of only having open ended discussions. Some variation would have made class a little more interesting.
Not very well organized as a class, basically just readings and discussion, little guided instructions and engagement

Strengths: Coherent structure, straightforward expectations, enjoyable experience
Weaknesses: Could be a bit more diverse in terms of what we did on a weekly basis (more debates or different discussion formats could have been useful)
I would recommend less texts so that students will focus on the texts distributed each week.

The course has so many strengths from which I benefitted a lot from. To begin with, Xiaoxiao has very carefully designed a syllabus that does not overly focus on the development of political psychology in studies of American politics. We covered a range of research in which political psychological methods are applied to study a diverse range of research questions in different regime types. In addition to the always informative course content, Xiaoxiao is also very supportive and instructive outside the classroom during office hours. I presented my research design to her, and over the course of the semester, she has very meticulously helped me to refine my research and point out directions and resources to look at in future studies. I feel so immensely lucky to have chosen the course and I am really appreciative of Xiaoxiao's continuous support!

The course is incredibly interesting and well-structured, and I found the readings to be accessible. I also loved the professor's teaching style and always found discussion questions from both the professor and my peers to be incredibly engaging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this to a student with no background in political psychology, but not to someone who has more background in this field. The readings were very introductory so good for someone who is trying to dip their toes in the water.
Yes! It's a great primer to understand research in the social sciences

Yes! If you would like to develop a deeper understanding of political psychology as a field and social science research methods in general. I would highly recommend you to take the course with Xiaoxiao!
I highly recommend this course! I'm a political science major, and it was by far one of my favorite courses I've taken within the department (and in general) at Yale.
